With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Bulky
sets.description:
• While Quaquaval's bulk is only serviceable, having both Roost and a great support movepool makes it a reasonable defensive option that does particularly well against Kingambit.

  • Taunt and Bulk Up: Taunt pairs particularly well with Bulk Up, letting it set up on surprising foes such as Corviknight.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Quaquaval stall out OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo, and it protects it from Garganacl's Salt Cure.

  • Encore: Not only does Encore give Quaquaval new chances to set up, but it also punishes passive play from Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Flying: While it has very little defensive synergy with Quaquaval's previous typing, Tera Flying lets Quaquaval effectively stall out Dondozo if using Taunt, or Substitute and Encore together.

  • Grass: Tera Grass makes Quaquaval's match-up against Rotom-W much smoother.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Quauqaval a better matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, who can be fairly problematic otherwise.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Quaquaval can set up against most defensive Garchomp thanks to the Dragon Tail immunity.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet pairs well with Taunt and Tera Flying, letting Quaquaval easily play around Dondozo and Corviknight while setting up Bulk Up.

  • Covert Cloak: If running Substitute isn't possible, Covert Cloak is Quaquaval's best shot at defeating Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread allows Quaquaval to outspeed Meowscarada while raising its special bulk. If not using Bulk Up, running Defense EVs is also viable instead.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 76 Def / 116 SpD / 68 Spe with Careful: The Special Defense investment and Careful nature let Quaquaval survive Choice Specs Hydreigon's Draco Meteor at full health, and the Speed lets it outspeed Garchomp after Aqua Step. The Defense investment lets Quaquaval avoid a 2HKO from Tera Dark Black Glasses Kingambit with one Supreme Overlord boost.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed ensures that Quaquaval outspeeds Choice Scarf Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult after using Aqua Step.

sets.name: Moxie Sweeper
sets.description:
• Aqua Step and Moxie give Quaquaval a niche as a late-game sweeper that doesn't always need a turn of setup.

  • Ice Spinner: This is Quaquaval's best way of dealing big damage to Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Encore: Encore lets Quaquaval punish slower foes such as Corviknight by getting an easy setup opportunity.

  • Roost: Recovery might seem odd on such an offensive Pokemon, but it helps Quaquaval avoid getting worn down against bulkier teams.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet's ability to pick off weakened threats pairs very well with Moxie, giving it new potential win conditions.

Tera Types

  • Water: Boosting Aqua Step's power opens up new sweeping chances late-game.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Quaquaval deal massive damage to Azumarill and wear down Dondozo switch-ins with Tera Blast.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Quaquaval potentially set up against would-be checks such as Rotom-W.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Quaquaval can get around Will-O-Wisp.

Items

  • Life Orb: The power increase makes sweeping with Aqua Step easier, especially against bulkier foes.

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Quaquaval trades potential wallbreaking for getting surprise sweeps against more offensive teams.

sets.name: Making Waves (3 Attacks + Roost)
sets.description: Quaquaval provides a decent offensive presence and valuable utility. Its typing in Water / Fighting and Roost allow it to soft check and threaten out foes like Chi-Yu, Roaring Moon, and Iron Moth. It's a solid spinner because it threatens out common entry hazard setters like Garganacl and Ting-Lu and spinblockers like Skeledirge. Aqua Step or Rapid Spin's Speed boost allows it to outspeed would-be revenge killers such as Kilowattrel and Chien-Pao, which lets Quaquaval potentially clean up late-game. Mystic Water + Primordial Sea provides more offensive presence and works well with Aqua Step for a recoil-less Water-type attack, while Magic Guard lets Quaquaval ignore Life Orb and Wave Crash recoil and lets it comfortably switch into entry hazards to make use of Rapid Spin. Rapid Spin variants pair well with hazard-stacking teammates like Garchomp and Ting-Lu; they also help switch into Desolate Land users like Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Ceruledge that wall Quaquaval, the latter of which can spinblock it reliably.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Choice Band Quaquaval is a solid wallbreaker thanks to its high-Base Power STAB moves backed up by a good Attack stat. Primordial Sea amplifies Wave Crash's power to even higher levels, but Sword of Ruin is an option to boost its other attacks, notably 2HKOing defensive Desolate Land Volcarona with Close Combat. Ice Spinner gives it coverage for Dragon-types such as Dragonite. U-turn lets Quaquaval gain momentum, taking advantage of Desolate Land users like Iron Moth, Ceruledge and Volcarona. Because of this, Quaquaval pairs well with teammates that can threaten them like Garchomp, Ting-Lu, and Dragonite; the former two also provide entry hazards to punish foes trying to switch around Quaquaval, while the latter appreciates Quaquaval wallbreaking early-game for it to sweep easier.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: The set(s) displayed are used as a placeholder until an analysis is written for this Pokemon. Stay tuned for any updates!

sets.name: Sticky Web Setter
sets.description: Prankster Spidops is the optimal Sticky Web setter for hyper offense teams. Spikes can be used to add more residual damage for opposing switch-ins, while Toxic Spikes synchronizes well with Hex users such as Skeledirge and Gengar. Taunt is used to block setup and Defog, while Circle Throw forces switches and can rack up residual damage in combination with Spikes. Focus Sash is used to ensure that Spidops can get up Sticky Web and at least one layer of Spikes before fainting. Slow wallbreakers like Chi-Yu and Quaquaval appreciate the opportunities provided by Sticky Web support. Setup attackers such as Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Ceruledge also pair well with Spidops, as it enables them to outspeed would-be revenge killers. Spidops struggles to set Sticky Web against spinners, so it's recommended to pair Spidops with a Ghost-type like Earth Eater Skeledirge that can beat spinners like Iron Treads. Additionally, common Dark-types like Kingambit and Roaring Moon can set up on Spidops lacking Circle Throw, so pairing it with a strong Fighting type like Slither Wing is advised.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Tera Bug is generally more useful to maximize Lokix's revenge killing capabilities, but Tera Fighting allows Lokix to OHKO Talonflame with Axe Kick.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Bug)
sets.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Tinted Offense
sets.description:
• The combination of First Impression and Tinted Lens make Lokix one of the most threatening revenge killers in the format, able to outprioritize and KO foes regardless of resistance.

  • First Impression is Lokix's most important attack, but it can only be used as the first attack after it switches in.

  • U-turn can be punishing against offensive and slow teams as the lack of resists means Lokix can keep switching in and dealing big damage with First Impression, at the cost of making it vulnerable to hazards.

  • Leech Life is the strongest Bug-type move Lokix learns outside of First Impression, with the added benefit of healing recoil damage.

  • Sucker Punch is a powerful STAB priority move, enabling Lokix to outprioritize foes even after it has used First Impression.

  • Axe Kick is the only coverage move of note in Lokix's moveset due to its high Base Power. Be wary of the low accuracy and recoil that occurs should it miss.

  • Throat Chop is the most powerful Dark-type move Lokix learns. It also has the side benefit of disabling Roar from Hippowdon and Hyper Voice from Sylveon.

  • Swords Dance is an option to make Lokix a sweeper instead of a revenge killer.

Items

Life Orb: Life Orb enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

Silver Powder: Silver Powder raises the power of First Impression without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

Bug: A Bug Tera Type increases the damage of First Impression, allowing Lokix to OHKO foes it could not otherwise, such as Dragapult.

sets.name: Revival Blessing
sets.description:
• Pawmot has a distinct niche as the best Revival Blessing user in the tier.
  • Tera Electric removes the downside of Double Shock, making it much safer to click.
  • Mach Punch helps pick off weakened foes such as Chien-Pao, Iron Bundle, and Tera Steel Koraidon.
  • Leppa Berry's purpose is to attempt to revive as many teammates as possible throughout a game.
  • Pawmot best fits on hyper offense teams, bringing back fainted teammates, but it also has a niche on bulkier teams.
  • Koraidon, Life Orb Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, and offensive Great Tusk often end up being KOed rather quickly through recoil for the former three and defensive drops for the latter. This makes them excellent targets for Pawmot's Revival Blessing. Choice Specs Chi-Yu is similarly left helpless after consecutive Overheat uses.
  • On bulkier teams, bringing back a self-sufficient wincon such as a fainted Annihilape or Skeledirge can be a viable strategy.
  • Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora and Froslass pair up nicely with the hyper offense aspects of the teams Pawmot finds itself on. Pawmot also beats the best Defogger in the tier in Corviknight.
  • Iron Bundle is a fantastic partner, beating the various Ground-types that switch into Pawmot such as Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Clodsire.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Offensive Utility
sets.description:
• Pawmot separates itself from Iron Hands by having an excellent support movepool and a good Speed tier.

  • Double Shock and Close Combat: Double Shock and Close Combat are its most important attacks, but note that it can only use Double Shock once without Terastallizing. Once Terastillized, Pawmot you can use Double Shock continuously for big damage, even on foes that resist it.

  • Mach Punch: Priority allows Pawmot to revenge kill better, hitting Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Iron Bundle super effectively.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Pawmot coverage against Ground-types, most notably Clodsire and Garchomp, in addition to hitting Dragapult for lots of damage.

  • Revival Blessing: Revival Blessing's one shot of reviving a teammate give Pawmot an extremely unique niche in turning battles around, though it doesn't fit all offensive teams.

  • Nuzzle This is notably one of the few ways to inflict paralysis on Gholdengo. Nuzzle is best when used with a Focus Sash, as Pawmot can paralyze the foe and outspeed it the next turn, getting another move off before it faints.

  • Encore: Encore does a great job of punishing passive play, and prevents easy setup from slower defensive foes such as Garganacl.

Other Options

  • Fake Out: This can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge.

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

vgc2023.overview:
• Pawmot has a strong niche in being one of only two Pokemon with a potentially game-winning tool in Revival Blessing. It is preferred over Rabsca thanks to its high Speed and better offensive typing, hitting Pokemon such as Murkrow, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon for OHKOs or near OHKOs. This, combined with its access to Fake Out, makes Pawmot useful offensively in addition to bringing Revival Blessing.

  • Powerful teammates such as Dondozo, when paired with Tatsugiri's Commander, and Meowscarada particularly appreciate Pawmot's Revival Blessing, as it gives them another opportunity at denting opposing teams. Choice Band Meowscarada pairs particularly well with Pawmot, as it can hit the only relevant Ground-type in Garchomp with both Flower Trick and Play Rough. Pawmot, in return, covers the few Pokemon that can handle Meowscarada's STAB moves, such as Hydreigon—even when it Terastallizes into a typing such as Steel.

  • Such Pawmot teams can, however, be vulnerable to well-played dual screens teams, which nullify most of the offensive presence from Pawmot's allies, even after it revives one of them. In particular, Pawmot teams must bring Pokemon and moves that can beat Amoonguss, which can be used on these teams.

sets.name: Revival Blessing Support
sets.description:
• Revival Blessing is an extremely invaluable tool that lets Pawmot revive crucial teammates such as Dondozo and Meowscarada, very likely turning the battle in the user's favor. It is Pawmot's most important move, but an attack is slotted first in case the timer forces Pawmot to use its first move. Double Shock is better here if Pawmot Terastallizes into the Electric typing, which lets it repeatedly use the move without drawback or failure. If running the Fighting Tera type or not Terastallized, Close Combat is better in this moveslot.

  • Focus Sash, in tandem with Pawmot's high Speed, ensures it gets at least two moves off if it is not double targeted.

  • Volt Absorb synergizes with Electric-weak teammates such as Dondozo, while Natural Cure allows Pawmot to brush off status moves such as Amoonguss's Spore.

  • Both the Electric and Fighting Tera types provide offensive benefits to Pawmot, turning an attack into a reliable source of damage against a plethora of common Pokemon such as Murkrow, Dondozo, and/or Hydreigon. The Electric Tera type lets it use Double Shock repeatedly, which avoids the drawback of Close Combat lowering its defenses, turning it into a potent cleaner.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description:
The combination of Iron Defense + Body Press lets Garganacl serve as a bulky and dangerous setup sweeper, allowing it to beat Pokemon it otherwise loses to, such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit. Salt Cure wears down common switch-ins such as Great Tusk, Gholdengo, Rotom-W, and Hatterene, as well as passive Pokemon like Toxapex and Corviknight, and forces them to burn recovery PP more often. Recover keeps Garganacl healthy throughout a game to check Pokemon like Ceruledge and Iron Moth and makes it more sustainable as a wincon. Purifying Salt prevents it from being crippled by Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Clodsire. It also provides a handy Ghost resistance, letting Garganacl potentially switch in on predicted Ghost-type moves from Pokemon like Dragapult and Skeledirge. Leftovers provides valuable passive recovery, reducing Garganacl's reliance on Recover. Maximum Special Defense EVs and a Careful nature maximize Garganacl's bulk, making it easier for Garganacl to switch in on Pokemon such as Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Dragapult and use them as setup fodder. Tera Water provides incredibly valuable resistances, letting Garganacl potentially check Gholdengo and Scizor while retaining its ability to pivot in on Fire-types like Cinderace. Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to turn the tables on Great Tusk while also preventing Breloom from revenge killing it. However, this does remove its resistance to Fire, making it more susceptible to Pokemon like Skeledirge and Ceruledge. Tera Ghost prevents Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk from reliably revenge killing Garganacl, letting it use them as setup fodder. It does negate the Ghost resistance provided by Purifying Salt, however, so another switch-in to Dragapult's Shadow Ball should be used.

Checks to strong wallbreakers like Iron Valiant and Breloom are good teammates; examples include the likes of Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. While Garganacl is given a Ghost resistance from Purifying Salt, it cannot fully check Dragapult and Gholdengo prior to Terastallization, with the latter completely countering it if it uses Covert Cloak. As such, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire make for great teammates. Pokemon like Corviknight and Scizor appreciate Garganacl checking Fire-types like Ceruledge and Skeledirge. Corviknight is notable in that it also forms a strong defensive core with Garganacl, checking Meowscarada for it. Entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and the aforementioned Corviknight are appreciated, as Garganacl is heavily pressured by entry hazards and cannot set up reliably if it is worn down. Frail, offensive Pokemon like Cinderace appreciate chip damage being forced onto their checks and having a strong defensive Pokemon to fall back on. Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Iron Valiant can pave the way for Garganacl to clean late-game, wearing down or significantly pressuring its checks in Gholdengo, Meowscarada, and Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description:
Garganacl is a great Stealth Rock setter thanks to its fantastic bulk, longevity with Recover, and ability to easily force switches against Great Tusk and outlast Defog Corviknight one-on-one. Protect alongside Salt Cure wears down entry hazard removal options such as Great Tusk and especially Corviknight due to its limited Roost PP and typing's vulnerability to Salt Cure. Protect also scouts out the intentions of Choice locked Pokemon such as Gholdengo and gives extra Leftovers recovery. Terastallization, lets Garganacl turn the tables on Great Tusk and Iron Treads lacking Iron Head, and makes it an incredibly consistent Stealth Rock setter. Specifically, Tera Fairy lets it completely wall Dragapult, while Tera Water lets it check Gholdengo, though this makes its matchup against opposing Garganacl much tougher. 116 Special Defense EVs let Garganacl take a Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Tera Dragon Dragapult at full health.

Garganacl fits on a wide variety of teams from bulky offense to stall thanks to it setting up Stealth Rock easily and having fantastic longevity. Ting-Lu is a fantastic partner since it can lay Spikes, and check Gholdengo and unboosted Kingambit, and wear down Corviknight much faster with Ruination thanks to Garganacl running Stealth Rock. Meowscarada and Great Tusk provide Knock Off support by removing Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak from Gholdengo and Toxapex to let Garganacl accrue Salt Cure damage more freely. Great Tusk also removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Gholdengo appreciates Great Tusk being worn down, since it shuts down other forms of entry hazard control well and fits alongside Garganacl and other entry hazard setters such as Garchomp. Cinderace lures in and uses U-turn on bulky Water-types such as Dondozo and Toxapex, giving Garganacl free entry to pressure them with Salt Cure

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description:
• The combination of Purifying Salt and access to reliable recovery and Iron Defense makes Garganacl a solid late-game wincon.
  • Body Press gains power very quickly with Iron Defense boosts and provides great coverage in tandem with Salt Cure.
  • Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to continue to set up against Great Tusk and Koraidon, which often switch in to handle Garganacl. Fairy also has few weaknesses in general.
  • Tera Water lets Garganacl take on Water-type attacks from Iron Bundle and Palafin.
  • Tera Steel is the best option to use on a sand team.
  • Garganacl with Special Defense investment works as a great check to Flutter Mane.
  • Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Scream Tail have a hard time doing any damage to Garganacl, making Koraidon a great partner.
  • Garganacl is unable to take on Miraidon and Iron Bundle. As such, Ting-Lu is recommended for dealing with Miraidon, while Corviknight, Blissey, and specially defensive Scream Tail can handle Iron Bundle.
  • While Garganacl works well regardless of the weather, Hippowdon deserves special mention as a teammate for providing sand support, greatly increasing Garganacl's Special Defense.

sets.name: Iron Defense
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

doublesou.overview: With solid defenses and access to reliable recovery, Garganacl can perform well in a utility role or with setup in Iron Defense. Its biggest selling points are its unique move and ability: Salt Cure offers valuable passive damage, synergizing well with its natural bulk, while Purifying Salt provides a useful immunity to status moves such as Spore and Toxic. Garganacl is difficult to break for many Pokemon, but it matches up notably well into Fire-types such as Chi-Yu and Arcanine, Flying-types like Dragonite and Iron Jugulis, and Amoonguss due to Purifying Salt. As one of the best Wide Guard users, Garganacl can block the format's many powerful spread attacks such as Gholdengo's Make It Rain, Chi-Yu's Heat Wave, and Armarouge's Expanding Force. Iron Defense lets Garganacl play as a potent wincon instead, increasing its Defense whilst simultaneously strengthening its offensive presence through Body Press. These sets can be very difficult to take down, though they often rely on using up Terastallization to be most effective. Garganacl's abysmal Speed means it will usually be relegated to moving last. Rock typing also leaves Garganacl with countless weaknesses, including to Water-, Steel-, and Fighting-type moves, meaning common Pokemon such as Palafin, Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Iron Hands, and Great Tusk all significantly threaten it. Amoonguss is one of the best partners for Garganacl, being helpful against several of the aforementioned threats, while Garganacl checks Fire-types like Chi-Yu in return, with redirection support and healing being especially critical for Iron Defense sets. Garganacl also appreciates teammates that can check Gholdengo, especially if not using Wide Guard, so Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Arcanine, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit are other desirable additions.
doublesou.comments:
Other Options

Other defensive Tera types are also usable depending on team needs. For example, Tera Poison still provides a Fighting-type resistance but doesn't gain the Dark-type weakness that Tera Ghost does. This means after Terastallization, Garganacl will still be good against Chi-Yu and gains immunity to Toxic Spikes, at the cost of not losing its Ground-type weakness. Tera Water is another alternative, offering helpful resists against Water-types like Palafin and Steel-types like Gholdengo.

sets.name: Bulky Utility
sets.description:
• Salt Cure forms Garganacl's offensive presence, dealing insignificant damage directly but leaving a powerful residual effect that lasts even after Garganacl leaves the field.

  • Recover complements Garganacl's bulk, allowing it to outheal most attacks while Salt Cure passively whittles down foes.

  • Wide Guard stops powerful spread attacks such as Make It Rain, Heat Wave, Expanding Force, and Earthquake. Stealth Rock alternatively offers chip damage throughout the match, breaking Focus Sashes and punishing attempts to remove Salt Cure's effect through switches.

  • Protect lets Garganacl rack up Leftovers recovery and Salt Cure damage. This is especially effective against the Water- and Steel-types that threaten Garganacl, as they take increased damae from Salt Cure's effect.

  • The given EV spread and nature patch up Garganacl's lower Special Defense, making it difficult to break through with both physical and special attacks, which is further aided by Leftovers for even more healing.

  • Purifying Salt provides an invaluable immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and a notable resistance to Gholdengo's Shadow Ball, which assists in stalling it out with Wide Guard.

  • Tera Ghost turns Garganacl's weakness to Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk into an immunity, effectively leaving it with a single weakness with Purifying Salt.

sets.name: Iron Defense
sets.description:
• Salt Cure provides passive damage, which is especially useful on this set for Pokemon that resist or are immune to Body Press, such as Gholdengo and Amoonguss.

  • Iron Defense makes Garganacl even more difficult to knock out, while Body Press lets the boosts double as an offensive bonus too.

  • Recover enhances Garganacl's staying power, increasing its effectiveness as a wincon.

  • EVs and nature are used to maximize special bulk, as Iron Defense covers the physical side. Leftovers tops out Garganacl's survivability with some passive healing.

  • Purifying Salt confers immunity to Spore and prevents a traditional form of setup counterplay in Toxic.

  • Tera Ghost gives a valuable Fighting-type immunity, notably including Sacred Sword, which will ignore the Defense boosts, and leaves Garganacl with effectively just one weakness in combination with Purifying Salt.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Iron Defense and Body Press: Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure: Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

  • Curse and Earthquake: While Curse is slower to set up than Iron Defense, it can be paired with Earthquake to potentially defeat Substitute Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers. Note that Curse will no longer boost Garganacl's stats when Terastallized.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Garganacl's chances of defeating Gholdengo, thanks to the Make It Rain resist.

  • Flying: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on new foes such as Great Tusk, Garchomp, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type stops Amoonguss from clearing its boosts with Clear Smog and makes Garganacl a decent check to Fairy-types such as offensive Mimikyu and Substitute + Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: If using Tera Flying Garganacl, maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

sets.name: Salty Stall
sets.description:
• With some entry hazard support, this Garganacl can be very difficult to outstall, thanks to the constant passive damage from Salt Cure.

  • Protect: Not only does Protect scout for surprise Tera types, but it also goes well with the passive healing from Leftovers.

  • Substitute: This makes Garganacl even more difficult to properly switch into, providing protection against Trick, OHKO moves, and opposing Salt Cure.

  • Fissure: Garganacl's great bulk makes it a prime candidate for fishing with Fissure itself, though its low PP can be an issue in mirror matches.

  • Stealth Rock: Since this set benefits so much from Stealth Rock support, running it on its own is a reasonable sacrifice if Garganacl needs to be more self-sufficient.

Other Options

  • Fling with Light Ball, Toxic Orb, or Flame Orb: Although the loss of Leftovers can be a huge blow for Garganacl, Fling and its associated status inducing items can be a devastating surprise for some of its offensive checks, such as Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Ghost: While removing Purifying Salt's Ghost resistance is a shame, Tera Ghost does wonderfully against Corviknight, Great Tusk, and opposing Garganacl due to the Body Press immunity, and in general removes all of Garganacl's common weaknesses.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gets rid of the Ground and Fighting weaknesses, giving it a far better chance of beating Great Tusk and Garchomp. It also makes Fissure no longer an issue.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy makes taking on powerful Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Roaring Moon an easier task.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Garganacl a better matchup against Gholdengo and Flutter Mane.

  • Grass: Tera Grass gives Garganacl a much easier time against Rotom-W and Palafin-H.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Curse's well-known different effect for Ghost-types being brought into play by Terastallization, Garganacl makes dangerous and diverse use of the move!

  • Tera Ghost Curse: If using Tera Ghost, Curse will change its effect, which drastically changes Garganacl's playstyle. While the 50% health cut can make it a tad risky, the Curse affliction is very powerful at wearing down Pokemon, including major foes that take advantage of Salt Cure, such as Covert Cloak Pokemon, bulky Substitute users, and Espathra Baton Pass chains. When combined with Salt Cure, it can even overwhelm bulky Pokemon with recovery, such as Dragonite.

  • Curse and Earthquake: Ghost Curse unfortunately does not work against Gholdengo, so using regular Curse alongside Earthquake makes Garganacl far less passive against against Gholdengo and frail Substitute users such as Flutter Mane. This is especially recommended if using other Tera types.

Tera Types

  • Ghost: In addition to being a great defensive typing that leaves Garganacl with only a weakness to Dark thanks to Purifying Salt, this is the Tera type that enables the unique properties of Curse.

  • Water: If messing with Gholdengo is the goal, Tera Water is an excellent choice, resisting the powerful Make It Rain and being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Steel: Tera Steel works very well against Flutter Mane and makes for a Make It Rain resistance against Gholdengo. However, retaining the Ground and Fighting weaknesses means it doesn't change as many matchups as other Tera types.

  • Flying: Tera Flying has excellent synergy with Garganacl's former typing, making it immune to Dondozo's Fissure and giving it a much better matchup against Meowscarada and Great Tusk. However, this comes at the cost of still making it vulnerable to Iron Bundle.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Garganacl is an incredibly reliable special wall. Sand Stream offers higher walling capabilities and forces extra chip damage on opponents, alternatively, Vessel of Ruin is a reliable option regardless of the weather. Stealth Rock supports its team with additional chip damage, and Protect can both scout opposing Choice-locked attackers and rack up Salt Cure damage; alternatively, IronPress threatens instant damage on foes, as well as boosts its Defense to better handle physical attackers like Dragonite. Earthquake hits opposing Garganacl and can offers progress against Magic Guard users, such as Greninja. Garganacl's best fit is on balance teams that want a reliable special wall and entry hazard support. Teammates like Good as Gold Skeledirge are recommended to prevent opposing Corviknight from using Defog to clear hazards. Rocky Helmet Corviknight can also punish Iron Treads and Brambleghast for switching in and using Rapid Spin. Garganacl struggles to deal with Greninja and Gengar, as both can OHKO it, so a teammate like Desolate Land Iron Moth helps cover these weaknesses.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description: Garganacl serves as a solid physically defensive Pokemon that checks threats such as Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Cinderace with its natural bulk and typing. Levitate notably prevents Garganacl from being worn down by Spikes and Toxic Spikes, but Earth Eater is an option on teams with reliable entry hazard control. Good as Gold can also be used to provide more defensive utility against common status moves, such as Switcheroo from Greninja and Defog from Corviknight, denying them and seizing momentum. Salt Cure chips switch-ins like Corviknight and Quaquaval. The listed setup and coverage moves enable Garganacl to accomplish feats like winning the one-on-one against Kingambit with Curse or IronPress, racking up chip damage with Salt Cure + Protect, and hitting Fluffy Dondozo with Earthquake on the switch-in. Garganacl benefits from teammates such as Desolate Land Volcarona and Iron Moth, which check Water-type threats such as Quaquaval and Greninja. It's also recommended to pair Garganacl with Pokemon that can account for Rapid Spin users such as Iron Treads, so teammates like Gengar and Brambleghast are great choices.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description: Garganacl is an astounding wincon due to the combination of Iron Defense + Body Press allowing it to beat Pokemon like Dragonite, Kingambit, and Great Tusk. Salt Cure makes easy progress and accrues chip damage on switch-ins like Gholdengo, Rotom-W, Heatran, and Great Tusk while also forcing Pokemon like Gastrodon and Mega Scizor to burn their recovery PP more often, making them passive and more easily worn down. Recover allows Garganacl to check Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Dragapult long-term and increasess its sustainability as a wincon. Tera Water allows Garganacl to check Pokemon like Gholdengo and Urshifu-R while providing valuable resistances to Steel- and Water-type moves. Notably, It allows Garganacl to stave off rain attackers such as Mega Swampert and Barraskewda. Alternatively, Tera Fairy lets Garganacl reliably set up in front of Pokemon like Great Tusk and Zamazenta while also being a near hard check to Dragapult. Maximum Special Defense investment allows Garganacl to deal with Pokemon like Tapu Koko and Choice Specs Dragapult reliably. Pokemon like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Gholdengo pair well with Garganacl as they serve as reliable defensive checks to strong wallbreakers like Urshifu-R, Iron Valiant, and Tapu Lele, respectively. Entry hazard removers like Tornadus-T and Great Tusk are also appreciated, as Garganacl is susceptible to chip damage from entry hazard. Garganacl mandates Knock Off support to serve as an effective wincon, as it can be pivoted around with Regenerator Pokemon holding Heavy-Duty Boots such as Toxapex and Slowbro without it. As such, partners such as the aforementioned Tornadus-T and Kingambit are useful. It additionally needs entry hazard support from Pokemon such as Clodsire and Heatran to outdamage Regenerator. Wallbreakers like Iron Valiant and Kartana appreciate their checks in Skeledirge and Gholdengo from being worn down by Salt Cure; these Pokemon also appreciate having Garganacl as a wall to fall back on. like Weavile, Tapu Lele, and Kingambit pair well with it, as they can immediately remove Pokemon that Garganacl would struggle with, such as Covert Cloak Gholdengo and Urshifu-R, (ac) letting it clean late-game.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description: Garganacl is a great entry hazard setter, as it takes advantage of the myriad of switches it forces with Salt Cure and ability to exploit passive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Clodsire. Salt Cure aggressively accumulates chip damage on switch-ins such as Urshifu-R and Kartana, and it punishes entry hazard removers like Great Tusk, Rotom-W, and Tornadus-T. Protect allows Garganacl to accrue more recovery from Leftovers and scout Pokemon like Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult, all while accruing chip damage on them with Salt Cure. Recover maintains Garganacl's longevity against Pokemon like Dragapult and Tapu Koko. Tera Water gives it neat resistances to Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes while also improving its matchup against rain wallbreakers such as Mega Swampert and Floatzel. Tera Fairy lets it handle Pokemon like Tera Grass Volcarona and Zamazenta safely, and it renders Dragapult useless against it. Maximum Special Defense investment allows Garganacl to deal with Pokemon like Volcarona, Tornadus-T, and Tapu Lele reliably. Pokemon like Toxapex, Kingambit, and Gholdengo support Garganacl as they deal with strong wallbreakers like Urshifu-R, Gholdengo, and Tapu Lele; Gholdengo in particular makes an amazing teammate as it prevents Defog and Rapid Spin from clearing Garganacl's Stealth Rock while also dealing with Pokemon like Mega Scizor and Kartana. Garganacl appreciates Knock Off users such as Tornadus-T and Toxapex, as they let it beat Regenerator Pokemon such as Slowbro and Toxapex with its own entry hazards. Pokemon that like their defensive checks being worn down due to Stealth Rock and Salt Cure such as Tapu Lele and Mega Medicham appreciate Garganacl's presence, as it wears down Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Gholdengo.

With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Expanding Force
sets.description:
• Armarouge's combination of powerful STAB moves, excellent coverage, Weak Armor, and Psychic Terrain makes it strong candidate to use Focus Sash.

  • Psychic Terrain Psychic Terrain is a powerful setup move for Armarouge thanks to Expanding Force; it also protects Armarouge from priority moves after Weak Armor triggers.

  • Expanding Force: Expanding Force under Psychic Terrain, especially with Tera Psychic, is a devastatingly powerful move.

  • Armor Cannon: This helps Armarouge defeat Steel-types that resist Expanding Force.

  • Aura Sphere: Aura Sphere is excellent coverage against the Dark-types.

  • Destiny Bond: This is a good alternative to forcefully take down threats that Armarouge can’t easily KO.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball hits the specially defensive Water-types Armarouge might struggle to defeat otherwise, most notably Gastrodon.

Tera Types

  • Psychic: With a boost from Tera Psychic, Expanding Force OHKOes even relatively bulky foes such as Garchomp and Flutter Mane. With Stealth Rock, Expanding Force still achieves most notable KOs without Tera Psychic, but the extra damage is still appreciated.

  • Fighting: In cases where setting up Psychic Terrain proves to be more difficult, Tera Fighting provides a useful resistance to Sucker Punch and powers up Aura Sphere.

vgc2023.overview:
• Armarouge is an amazing Trick Room setter and powerful offensive Pokemon. Few Pokemon resist Psychic + Fire, and Armor Cannon and Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain are very powerful attacks. With minimum Speed, Armarouge in Trick Room outpaces a large portion of the metagame.

  • Armarouge appreciates Pokemon that can help it set Trick Room, like Choice Scarf Annihilape thanks to Final Gambit, and redirectors such as Amoonguss and Indeedee-F; Indeedee-F is a particularly good teammate due to Psychic Surge massively improving Expanding Force.

  • Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Tyranitar are all strong and common Pokemon that can give Armarouge a hard time. Fighting-type teammates like Hariyama, Paldean Tauros-W, and Annihilape help check Hydreigon and Tyranitar. Garchomp can be checked by Pokemon like Rotom-W, Abomasnow, and Tera Steel Hydreigon.

sets.name: Trick Room
sets.description:
• Armor Cannon is a nuclear single-target attack that can OHKO Amoonguss, OHKO Kingambit, and even give a good shot to 2HKO Grimmsnarl through Light Screen. Alternatively, Heat Wave is a strong spread move option alongside Life Orb, which compensates for its considerably lower power than Armor Cannon. Being a spread move, it doesn't mind redirection users like Rage Powder Amoonguss or make Armarouge choose between targeting one of two Protect users.

  • Psychic is used when not paired with Indeedee-F. Expanding Force is preferred alongside Indeedee-F, which makes Expanding Force much stronger and a spread move via Psychic Terrain.

  • Wide Guard protects Armarouge and its teammates from attacks like Garchomp's Earthquake and Tyranitar's Rock Slide. Energy Ball lets Armarouge OHKO Rotom-W and TeraGround Garchomp with Tera Grass,and it has a good chance to 2HKO Tyranitar with Life Orb, even without Terastallizing. Aura Sphere 2HKOes Hydreigon and Tyranitar, and with Life Orb, it OHKOes them with minimal damage.

  • Life Orb makes Armarouge very powerful, securing OHKOs against Pokemon like Maushold, slightly chipped Hatterene, and, with Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain, slightly chipped Garchomp and Rotom-W. Safety Goggles grants Armarouge immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder.

  • A Grass Tera type gives Armarouge Ground and Water resistances, which are good against Garchomp and Rotom-W. Tera Dark is a good option to improve matchups against Ghost- and Psychic-types like Ceruledge, Skeledirge, and opposing Armarouge, make Armarouge immune to Prankster Murkrow's Taunt, and give it a resistance to Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Dark Pulse can be used alongside Tera Dark to more heavily damage Ghost- and Psychic-types, though outside of opposing Armarouge, Life Orb Psychic can usually 2HKO them.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Armarouge is a passable revenge killer that outspeeds naturally fast Pokemon like Cinderace and Chien-Pao, threatening them with its high-Base Power STAB attacks. Moreover, it can clean up late-game easily thanks to Psychic Surge, which protects it from common priority attacks such as Dragonite's Extreme Speed, Slither Wing's First Impression, and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Trick cripples bulky foes it can't immediately threaten like Blissey, Florges, and Garganacl. Focus Blast hits Chi-Yu and Roaring Moon, while Psyshock 2HKOes Clodsire. Utility moves in Destiny Bond and Will-O-Wisp can also be used, with the former checking setup sweepers like Dragonite and the latter punishing switch-ins. Wallbreakers like Greninja can overwhelm shared checks and appreciate Armarouge's Psychic Terrain protecting them from the likes of Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak and Dragonite's Extreme Speed. Armarouge's susceptibility to entry hazards makes teammates like Defog Corviknight and Rapid Spin Iron Treads valuable options.

sets.name: Bulk Up Sweeper
sets.description:
• Bulk Up Ceruledge makes excellent use of both its respectable bulk and Bitter Blade's high recovery. By changing its typing to a more defense oriented one, while maintaining the Fire immunity thanks to Flash Fire, Ceruledge can set up Bulk Ups on a variety of common Pokemon, ranging from Corviknight, Kingambit, Azumarill and Gholdengo.

  • Taunt: Taunt lets Ceruledge set up Bulk Up without needing to fear common phasing moves (with the exception of attacking moves such as Dragon Tail), as well as opposing setup moves such opposing Bulk Up and Iron Defense, provided you outspeed.

  • Shadow Sneak Priority of some form is always nice to have on a Pokemon, which makes Shadow Sneak an easy contender for the last move. Gaining extra added strength against Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Dragapult and Annihilape is certainly charming.

  • Grass Tera Blast: This allows Ceruledge to eliminate Dondozo more quickly. While Taunt can shut down Dondozo's Yawn, it cannot shut down Fissure. The only way to beat Dondozo would be to eliminate it as quickly as possibly, which Grass Tera Blast aids with.

  • Flame Charge: Flame Charge provides Ceruledge an extra net of safety against potential Scarf users and Annihilape, who are capable of turning the tides against it. While normally, Ceruledge is prone to faster Taunt + Bulk Up users and Scarfed Trick, Flame Charge helps mitigate both of those weaknesses.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Ceruledge can be a status spreader in games where it can't set up as easily. It also helps Ceruledge set up more easily against threats such as Unaware Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps Ceruledge's matchup against prominent Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Grass: An immunity to Spore and a resistance to Water makes Grass the most notable Tera type for this set. Flash Fire eliminating one of Grass's many weaknesses is also noteworthy.

  • Fire: Increasing Bitter Blade's power will always be a valuable trait. Eliminating Ghost's weaknesses to Ghost and Dark also allows Ceruledge to set up more comfortably.

  • Bug: Tera Bug is similar to Tera Grass, but in exchange for losing the Water resistance and maintaining the Rock weakness of Fire / Ghost, Ceruledge can tank Volcarona's Bug Buzz with significantly more ease.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def with Impish: Investing into Defense prepares Ceruledge and its mediocre physical bulk for the physical-biased metagame. Bulk Up will boost its Defense, but it can struggle to take some physical hits even after a boost, and its special bulk is naturally high.

  • 252 HP / 252 Spe with Jolly: A faster spread helps Ceruledge outspeed other Bulk Up users, like Annihilape opting to invest in bulk. Being faster, more often than not, lets Ceruledge win these matchups with ease.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD with Careful: While most threats in the metagame at the moment are physical, a specially defensive spread is still noteworthy for its ability to surprise Hydreigon.

sets.name: Focus Sash Attacker
sets.description:
• With a stellar offensive typing, a unique set of attacks, Weak Armor allowing it to outspeed a large part of the metagame, and its immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, Ceruledge proves itself to be a very solid Focus Sash option.

  • Bitter Blade: Bitter Blade's recovery can make Focus Sash usable even if entry hazards chip it. If Ceruledge is brought down to 1 HP, a +2 Bitter Blade can heal it to the point that it can tank an extra attack.

  • Close Combat versus Shadow Claw: Close Combat hits the Normal-, Dark-, and Rock-types that resist Ceruledge's STAB combination. Still, Shadow Claw is a noteworthy choice to guarantee the KO on Mimikyu and let Ceruledge pressure Skeledirge. Note, however, that maximum Defense Skeledirge can recover more than Shadow Claw's damage, barring critical hits, and a Terastallized Skeledirge can completely wall this set.

  • Swords Dance versus Destiny Bond: As powerful as Swords Dance boosted attacks from Ceruledge are, the abundance of Unaware Pokemon, primarily Dondozo, has made some players opt to use Destiny Bond to snag surprise kills. Destiny Bond can also make the matchup against KOing common Sucker Punch Pokemon, such as Meowscarada and Kingambit, easier to win without having to rely on predictions.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant's added damage output is valuable, but Jolly allows Ceruledge to outspeed non-Scarf Gholdengo, and gives it a chance at outspeeding Modest Rotom formes and Glimmora. All of the mentioned examples are Special Attackers, meaning Ceruledge's Weak Armor often does not trigger in these matchups.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Giving Bitter Blade an extra push in damage is quite useful, giving Ceruledge more recovery.

  • Normal: Normal is an exceedingly common Tera Type on Ghost types due to the immunity it brings to the table. Ceruledge makes particularly excellent use of Normal Tera by resisting both Steel and Fairy, making it very difficult for Gholdengo and Mimikyu to click anything other than a Ghost type move when facing off against Ceruledge.

  • Fighting: Giving extra reach pwer to Close Combat, a powerful option against Pokemon such as Hydreigon, makes Fighting a solid choice for a Tera Type.

vgc2023.overview:
• Ceruledge is a strong Bulk Up sweeper in Series 1. The combination of Bulk Up's Defense boost and Bitter Blade's healing help Ceruledge stay healthy during a sweep.

  • Ceruledge's unique defensive qualities let it set up in the face of Pokemon like Torkoal, Maushold, and Arcanine, and Tera Grass lets it set up against even more Pokemon. Pokemon that can help Ceruledge set up like Rage Powder Amoonguss can make good teammates.

  • Ceruledge struggles against some of the metagame's best Pokemon like Hydreigon, Tyranitar, and Garchomp. Paldean Tauros-A, Sylveon, and Pawmot check Hydreigon and Tyranitar for Ceruledge. Tera Steel Hydreigon, Rotom-W, and Abomasnow check Garchomp.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Shadow Sneak finishes off weakened Pokemon, Focus Sash users like Kilowattral, hits opposing Ceruledge, and lets Ceruledge revenge kill Ghost-weak Pokemon like Gholdengo. Tera Blast + Tera Grass lets Ceruledge hit Fire-resistant Pokemon like Tyranitar, Rotom-W, and Garchomp.

  • Clear Amulet prevents Ceruledge from being weakened by Intimidate users like Paldean Tauros-A, Arcanine, and Gyarados, as well as Parting Shot Grimmsnarl.

  • Grass is easily Ceruledge's best Tera type, giving it a Water and Ground resistance for the likes of Garchomp and Rotom-W and making it immune to Amoonguss's powder moves. Flash Fire lets Ceruledge do extremely well against opposing Fire-types, especially when Terastallized, as it will shed its weakness to super effective coverage moves like Torkoal's Earth Power and opposing Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Ceruledge is an incredibly powerful wallbreaker due to its potent offensive typing, boosted Fire-type attacks, and stellar coverage. Shadow Sneak makes up for Ceruledge's lackluster Speed and can finish off faster Pokemon. Solar Blade and Close Combat provide coverage against foes that tank Ceruledge's STAB moves, such as Garganacl, Chi-Yu, and Roaring Moon. Alternatively, Will-O-Wisp gives up coverage for the ability to cripple switch-ins like Garchomp and Hippowdon. Desolate Land provides Ceruledge with some defensive utility by checking opposing Primordial Sea users, in addition to enabling Bitter Blade and Solar Blade. Due to Ceruledge's frailty, it appreciates pivoting and entry hazard removal from teammates like Corviknight and Iron Treads. Strong special attackers such as Greninja can pair with Ceruledge to break down each other's checks, such as Garganacl and Garchomp and Blissey and Corviknight, respectively.

sets.name: Choiced Attacker
sets.description: Ceruledge's sun-boosted Bitter Blade offers a combination of power and longevity scarcely seen in a wallbreaker. Choice Band Bitter Blade 2HKOes the majority of the metagame, while Choice Scarf Ceruledge outpaces Chien-Pao and Cinderace. Close Combat hits Garganacl and Well-Baked Body Steel-types, and Solar Blade hits bulky Ground and Water-types such as Hippowdon and Dondozo. Will-O-Wisp cripples many of Ceruledge's switch-ins, such as Garganacl. On Choice Band sets, a Jolly Nature is useful for outpacing opposing Ceruledge and Gholdengo. Besides weather control, Desolate Land enables Ceruledge to perform feats such as offensively checking Barraskewda. Ceruledge's Stealth Rock weakness and lackluster bulk make Defog and pivot support from a teammate like Corviknight very valuable. Knock Off users such as Iron Treads and Meowscarada greatly complement Ceruledge's own offensive prowess and burn spreading capabilities; defensive cores can quickly crumble under the weight of entry hazards, burn chip, and repeated subjection to sun-boosted Bitter Blade. Fast special attackers like Greninja and Gengar help deal with faster threats and Garganacl.

sets.name: Tactical Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt can be quite unassuming, and specially offensive Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Rotom may see it as a free opportunity to get into position. Assault Vest turns the tides against them with Electromorphosis + Parabolic Charge, which makes Bellibolt seem impossible to remove for certain Pokemon. It's also a decent check against Iron Bundle.

  • Grass- or Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important coverage to have; with a Fairy Tera type, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragon-types.

  • Muddy Water versus Chilling Water: Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric for much-needed coverage. Alternatively, Chilling Water weakens common switch-ins such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur, allowing you to reposition your team more safely.

  • Acid Spray: This threatens non-Steel type switch-ins, and it also lets Bellibolt effectively use Electromorphosis without having to take damage first. It's also a powerful tool against Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

  • Sucker Punch: While weak, Sucker Punch snipes Pokemon that activate Focus Sash and/or deals chip damage when Bellibolt is guaranteed to go down.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy Bellibolt offensively checks big threats like Roaring Moon and Dragapult by walling their non-Terastal sets and nabbing surprise KOs.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass Bellibolt can stay in versus common Pokemon such as Hippowdon and Breloom, sponge their attacks, and either chunk them or survive and reposition.

  • Electric-type: Maximizing Parabolic Charge damage is a viable option.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 28 Spe: This spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Rotom-W and Hydreigon's Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon. 28 Defense EVs are enough to survive Focus Sash Garchomp's Earthquake, which notably becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground.

sets.name: Fat Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt's stats allow it to be deceptively bulky, and a pure Electric typing is not terrible on a defensive Pokemon with reliable recovery and pivoting.

  • Parabolic Charge: Parabolic Charge gives Bellibolt a more constant stream of recovery, though it is much less punishing than Discharge.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch maintains initiative when predicting switches after bringing Bellibolt in on something that it walls, such as defensive Gholdengo or Corviknight.

  • Chilling Water: Chilling Water punishes Garchomp and Hippowdon on the switch.

  • Thunder Wave: This disrupts opponents if Bellibolt doesn't have Discharge.

  • Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast hits common Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur after Terastallizing into the Fairy typing.

  • Soak: Soak catches Electric-resistant foes on the switch and forces them to either switch out or Terastallize early, with major targets including Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Terastallizing into the Grass typing flips the matchup against Ground-types like Hippowdon and Garchomp on its head, turning their super effective attacks into resisted hits that still activate Electromorphosis. Tera Grass Bellibolt also absorbs Spore versus Breloom and Amoonguss, effectively walling them as well.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera Bellibolt comfortably walls Dragon-types, removing a lot of their offensive pressure.

  • Water: Water is just generally good to have as a defensive Tera type. It also gives Bellibolt STAB on Chilling Water for slightly more damage.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive two Glaive Rushes from Adamant Baxcalibur if it is not in a position to Terastallize. The physical bulk lets Bellibolt always survive Life Orb Garchomp's Earthquake, and after Terastallization into a neutral type, it becomes a 3HKO. 28 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers provides long-term passive recovery alongside Slack Off, which can make Bellibolt very difficult to remove. Leftovers also removes any chance of a 2HKO from powerful physical threats such as Baxcalibur.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a good backup option if Leftovers is already in use.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet Bellibolt can switch into and passively punish physical attackers; the chip damage can also break Focus Sash and weaken foes into range of Electromorphosis-boosted attacks.

sets.name: Bespectacled Bellibolt
sets.description:
• With such good natural bulk, Bellibolt can easily survive hits from common threats and nab surprise KOs in return with a cheeky Choice Specs set.

  • Discharge / Thunderbolt: Discharge or Thunderbolt is the preferred primary STAB move, as either one takes advantage of Choice Specs more than Parabolic Charge. With an Electromorphosis boost, Bellibolt can 2HKO common switch-ins without having to Terastallize, like Dragapult.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important for coverage; with a Fairy typing, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragon-types. Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric.

  • Muddy Water versus Parabolic Charge: Muddy Water lets Bellibolt win one-on-one against Hippowdon. Parabolic Charge should be used alongside Muddy Water if running Tera Electric.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy lets Bellibolt turn the tables on bulky Dragon-types such as Baxcalibur and Roaring Moon by scoring a surprise KO on a potential setup attempt.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass turns Bellibolt's only weakness into a resistance, and Tera Blast gets surprise OHKOs on threats such as physically defensive Hippowdon.

  • Electric-type: Tera Electric + Choice Specs turns Bellibolt into an offensive behemoth, and with an Electromorphosis boost it can OHKO resistant Pokemon like Dragapult, Hydreigon, and specially defensive Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 196 SpA / 28 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive Choice Specs-boosted Draco Meteor from Hydreigon and Earthquake from Focus Sash Garchomp; Garchomp's Earthquake becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground. The Speed EVs outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon, while the Special Attack EVs are enough to OHKO physically defensive Hippowdon with Muddy Water.

sets.name: Offensive Electric Immunity (Flying)
sets.description: These are the sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2023.overview:
• Kilowattrel stands out as one of the best Tailwind setters in the current metagame. Its base 125 Speed stat lets it set Tailwind first, with very little Prankster Tailwind Pokemon stopping it from doing so.

  • Kilowattrel has a respectable base 105 Special Attack stat and a good offensive typing, allowing it to tackle the likes of Meowscarada and Gyarados well.

  • Kilowattrel appreciates immediately hard-hitting partners such as Choice Specs Gholdengo and Garchomp to break through opposing teams. Gholdengo is great in particular thanks to its immunity to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel is particularly frail, meaning it often only gets to set Tailwind and fire off a single attack before it faints. It also means in late-game scenarios, it is unreliable at dueling the meta's most common attackers like Gholdengo and Hydreigon.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Air Slash is Kilowattrel's primary Flying-type STAB move of choice due to its higher accuracy than Hurricane, though the latter may be seen on rain teams.

  • Discharge is a good spread option when next to a Ground- or Electric-type partner like Garchomp or Rotom-F. Volt Switch allows Kilowattrel to use its high base Speed to pivot into a partner that can better use the extra Speed from Tailwind.

  • Competitive acts as an Intimidate-deterrent for physically attacking partners such as Garchomp, Baxcalibur, and Ceruledge.

  • Focus Sash is a must-have, as Kilowattrel is incredibly frail and unable to take any super effective or strong neutral attacks such as Baxcalibur's Icicle Crash and Tera Normal Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel rarely Terastallizes, but when it does, it prefers to use same type Tera to boost the power of one of its STAB moves.

sets.name: Primordial Sea
sets.description: Primordial Sea Kilowattrel is a powerful threat with excellent Speed, strong weather-boosted moves, great coverage, and pivoting. Naturally outspeeding most common threats except Chien-Pao and Barraskewda, Kilowattrel can safely pivot or threaten massive damage against the entire tier. Choice Specs 2HKOes fully invested Ting-Lu and Clodsdire with Weather Ball. U-turn provides safe pivoting with no immunities, while Volt Switch is significantly stronger and provides important coverage if forgoing Thunder. Kilowattrel excels in VoltTurn cores, while also acting as a sweeper in the right scenarios, making other pivots such as Roaring Moon and Cinderace excellent partners. Powerful cleaners like Choice Band Dragonite appreciate Kilowattrel breaking their common Steel-type switch-ins, and setup attackers mesh well with Kilowattrel’s ability to OHKO Corviknight. Kilowattrel is extremely weak to common priority users like Chien-Pao making sturdy physical walls like Intimidate Garganacl great partners. Defensive pivots like Corviknight and Iron Treads also provide much needed Stealth Rock removal, if running Choice Specs.

sets.name: Bulky Prankster
sets.description: Alternative spread: 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD. Can be used if not running Gunk Shot to better switch into Gengar.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: Toedscool is one of the premier forms of entry hazard removal in Little Cup. Toedscool spreads sleep and removes entry hazards, punishing Spore absorbers and spinblockers with Knock Off while using its good natural bulk and typing to serve as a check to Ground- and Electric-types. The given EV spread allows Toedscool to hit 17 Speed, which outspeeds common 16 Speed entry hazard setters like Glimmet and Pawniard. Toedscool can also opt for a Grass-type STAB move over Spore to give it more offensive presence. Power Whip provides a better matchup into opposing Toedscool, while Giga Drain gives it a form of recovery, a secondary STAB that cannot miss, and the ability to beat Mudbray. If running Power Whip, Toedscool should use an EV spread of 36 HP / 36 Atk / 156 Def / 36 SpA / 36 SpD / 196 Spe with a Jolly nature. Toedscool's Tera type occasionally allows it to avoid a super effective Ice-type move. Tera Water is preferred, as the added resistance to Water-type attacks also allows Toedscool to be an emergency check to rain teams and setup Quaxly sets. Tera Steel can also be used to deal with Tera Ice Electric-types more easily and to give it a favorable matchup against Foongus, but at the cost of adding unfortunate Ground and Fighting weaknesses. Toedscool pairs well with Pokemon that struggle with Stealth Rock chip, like Larvesta, Nymble, and Wattrel, and teammates that appreciate the momentum that Toedscool generates, like Magnemite, Mankey, and Hisuian Zorua. Water-types such as Mareanie and Quaxly have defensive synergy with Toedscool, both checking the Ice- and Fire-types that threaten Toedscool and benefitting from Toedscool's ability to absorb Electric-type moves.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Sun Attacker
sets.description:
• Tera Fire Scovillain's damage under sun is absurd, managing to barely KO even Fire-resistant targets. Most notably, its ability to defeat most Pokemon, even powerful Dragon-types, without fearing surprise Terastallizations makes Scovillain a charming offensive option.

  • Overheat and Fire Blast: Overheat combined with Tera Fire and Choice Specs guarantees the KO on Garchomp without bulk EVs, and OHKO offensive Roaring Moon after Stealth Rock damage. Against the frailer Dragapult, Tera Fire and Fire Blast is enough to earn the KO. It's recommended to run both Fire STAB moves because Overheat's added damage can be necessary to guarantee certain KOs, but its stat drop can be fatal.

  • Solar Beam versus Leaf Storm: Solar Beam nails the few bulky Water-types that can survive Scovillain's absurd attacks, most notable examples being notably Gastrodon and Assault Vest Azumarill. However, Leaf Storm can be used in its stead for the ability to OHKO Hippowdon, despite it summoning sand.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower is perfectly accurateand is typically more than enough to nip off frailer foes.

  • Substitute: In spite of the type matchup, Scovillain is deceptively weak to Kingambit thanks to Sucker Punch. Additionally, many Pokemon will use Protect in front of Scovillain to waste sun turns— most notably Espathra and Dondozo. Against all of these foes, a well-timed Substitute can guarantee the win.

Tera Types

  • Fire: It is almost mandatory to run Tera Fire on this Scovillain set. Tera Fire guarantees KOs on most Dragon-types.

  • Ghost: The abundantly common Dragonite is incredibly strong against Scovillain. Should Stealth Rock support be deemed enough to let Scovillain sweep teams reasonably, even without Tera Fire, using Tera Ghost to gain an immunity to Extreme Speed can be very useful.

  • Rock: Tera Rock with Tera Blast can be a decent alternative to Tera Fire, as it gives Scovillain excellent coverage and also provides a much-needed countermeasure to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Moody Ace
sets.description:
• The metagame's abundance of Unaware Pokemon makes it difficult to maneuver Moody Pokemon in general. On top of that, Scovillain is held back by the powerful Dragon-types that resist its STAB combination. However, Scovillain still carves a niche for itself by being the only Moody Pokemon with excellent recovery moves, Leech Seed and Ingrain, allowing it to win a variety of matchups.

  • Protect and Substitute: Protect and Substitute are mandatory to get the most opportunities to activate Moody. Once you gain enough Defense or Special Defense boosts that Scovillain's Substitute can tank an attack without breaking, it tends to be easy to win the game. Note, however, that Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers's animation make Scovillain very vulnerable to losing via timer.

  • Flamethrower: With enough Moody boosts, Scovillain's Flamethrower tends to be enough to break through an entire team. There are very few Pokemon that are immune or quadruply resistant to Fire, and Flamethrower has good PP and accuracy, which makes it an easy pick.

  • Giga Drain: Unlike Flamethrower, Giga Drain gets shrugged off by a lot of Pokemon, even at +6, notably Corviknight and Dragonite. However, an attacking move that helps recover HP lost from Substitutes helps it gain gives Scovillain more mileage off of Moody. Giga Drain is also notable to more reliably defeat Dondozo, one of the Unaware Pokemon that would give Scovillain a lot of trouble otherwise.

  • Leech Seed: Leech Seed combined with Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers helps Scovillain restore HP while collecting Moody boosts, as well as chipping Pokemon it'd otherwise have trouble against, such as Clodsire.

  • Ingrain: Ingrain is an alternative recovery option that makes Scovillain impervious to phazing moves. When purely considering recovery, it's more reliable than the inaccurate 90% accurate Leech Seed.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast with Tera Fairy is an excellent option that helps remedy Scovillain's Dragon susceptibility, particularly making the Infiltrator Dragapult and Roaring Moon matchup easier.

Tera Types

  • Water: The Water resistance helps Scovillain beat Dondozo. Even though Dondozo ignores Scovillain's Defense boosts via Unaware, with Tera Water, Scovillain's Substitute can tank a Wave Crash. Tera Water also keeps the Scovillain's Steel resistance, unlike Tera Grass, which makes it easier to check Scizor—a common priority user that people attempt to use to check Moody Pokemon.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy mitigating Scovillain's weakness to Dragon-types is massively helpful.

EV Spreads

  • 180 HP / 220 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 100 Spe with Bold: This spread bolsters Scovillain’s physical bulk. Notably, Tera Water Scovillain's Substitute manages to survive Dondozo's Wave Crash with this spread. The Speed allows Scovillain to outspeed slow Baxcalibur and Gholdengo, as well as Dragapult with one Moody Speed boost. The HP is adjusted to make maximum use of Leftovers, with the resulting stat having a remainder of 1 when divided by 16. The remaining EVs are split between Special Attack and Special Defense because, at level 50, investing 8 EVs in either stat has no benefit over investing 4.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• Espathra's niche is sweeping with its unique combination of Calm Mind, Speed Boost, and STAB Stored Power.
  • Dazzling Gleam super effectively hits Dark-types, which are immune to Stored Power, like Chien-Pao, Ting-Lu, and Grimmsnarl.
  • Substitute protects Espathra from potential status conditions that might stop its sweep, like from Clodsire's Toxic.
  • Protect, instead, allows Espathra to scout Choice-locked foes, such as Choice Specs Miraidon. In addition, Protect lets Espathra freely boost its Speed and get Leftovers recovery.
  • Roost keeps Espathra healthy and makes it less susceptible to priority attacks, like Chien-Pao and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Roost also allows Espathra to beat Ting-Lu not packing Whirlwind one-on-one.
  • Tera Fairy turns Espathra's Dark weakness into a resistance, letting it survive the aforementioned Sucker Punch, as well as bolstering its Dazzling Gleam.
  • Tera Fighting also turns Espathra's Dark weakness into a resistance. Paired with Tera Blast, it beats the aforementioned Dark-types, Kingambit and Chien-Pao, and Steel-types like Iron Treads.
  • 112 EVs in Speed allow Espathra to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame at +1, including Iron Bundle. At +2, it can even outspeed +1 Iron Valiant.
  • The rest of its EVs are poured into physical bulk for survivability, since Calm Mind will boost Special Defense anyway. Electric Seed further improves Espathra's physical bulk while also giving it another boost to Stored Power. Leftovers gives Espathra long-term recovery, and it can be optimized with Calm Mind and the choice of Substitute, Protect, or Roost.
  • Espathra functions best on offensive teams to sweep after its checks have been weakened. Espathra is very frail and it usually can't switch in safely more than once, so it must fully commit to a sweep once it hits the field.
  • Fighting-types like Koraidon and Great Tusk make for good partners, as they threaten Dark- and Steel-types that resist or are immune to Espathra's Stored Power.
  • Strong Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu resist Dark- and Ghost-type attacks, which target Espathra, while also threatening Ghost- and Psychic-types. The former threaten Espathra, and the latter resist Stored Power.
  • Miraidon is a necessary partner if Espathra is holding Electric Seed, as Electric Terrain activates the item.

sets.name: Calm Mind

With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Speed Passer
sets.description:
• Espathra is the only option for the coveted Speed Boost + Baton Pass combination, which can be extremely deadly for setting up sweeps!

  • Lumina Crash: Lumina Crash ensures that Espathra isn't totally shut down by Taunt, and the guaranteed -2 Special Defense drop helps against Unaware walls.

  • Reflect: Reflect can stop priority attacks from easily revenge killing your chosen Baton Pass partner.

  • Some Teammates: While most Pokemon love getting Baton Pass boosts, especially consider Pokemon that resist Espathra's common weaknesses, such as Hydreigon, Roaring Moon Sylveon, and Kingambit. Corviknight is also worth considering due to Power Trip.

Other Options

  • Hypnosis: While extremely risky, putting a foe to sleep lets Espathra easily stack up on boosts.

Tera Types

  • Espathra should usually avoid Terastallizing if possible, since its point is to help other Pokemon sweep. Consider these two options as fairly situational.

  • Normal: With a Normal Tera type, Espartha can set up against its Ghost types and isn't worried about Shadow Sneak anymore.

  • Ghost: Ghost Tera type makes Espartha immune to Extreme Speed, making passing against Dragonite much easier.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is the best way to guarantee passing at least one Speed boost, though it's a lackluster option for passing multiple boosts compared to other items.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the easy option to recommend since it pairs well with Protect and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry should be used if Espathra is planning on passing Speed to teammates that want Leftovers, such as Skeledirge and Garganacl.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• With Calm Mind and Speed Boost rapidly increasing Stored Power's damage output, Espathra is a dangerous wincon against bulkier teams, as it even overwhelms Unaware foes.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This provides coverage against Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Protect versus Substitute: Protect is the most reliable way to get a free turn of Speed Boost. Substitute is a riskier option for Speed Boost stalling, but it severely punishes passive Pokemon and works extremely well on dual screen teams.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread allows Espathra to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: When paired with Tera Blast, Tera Fighting is Espathra's best hope of defeating Kingambit.

  • Fire: Tera Fire and Tera Blast roast Scizor, and deal massive damage to Gholdengo and Kingambit.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type makes setting up on Hydreigon a much more realistic scenario and severely punishes Choice-locked Dragon-types like Dragapult.

  • Dark: Tera Dark provides gives Espathra a valuable Shadow Sneak resistance and does a better shot of defeating weakened Gholdengo.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description:
• Tinkaton boasts an impressive support movepool alongside a fantastic typing in Fairy / Steel.

  • Encore: Encore can open up opportunities for teammates, locking foes into status moves or attacks that a teammate resists.

  • Thunder Wave: With Mold Breaker, Tinkaton is capable of paralyzing Gholdengo and Garganacl with Thunder Wave.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Flying Tera makes Tinkaton immune to Ground, which can be useful in avoiding Earthquake from the likes of Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Tera Ground Baxcalibur.

  • Fire: Fire Tera turns Tinkaton's Fire-type weakness into a resistance, allowing it to use Encore on Volcarona.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 164 Def / 20 SpD / 76 Spe with Careful: The HP and Defense investment lets Tinkaton survive Adamant Dragonite's Earthquake into Extreme Speed. The Special Defense investment allows Tinkaton to survive one Timid Choice Specs Fire Blast from Hydreigon, two Modest Choice Specs Shadow Balls from Dragapult, and three uninvested Shadow Balls from Gholdengo. The Speed investment allows Tinkaton to outspeed a paralyzed non-Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

Items

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon lets Tinkaton set up Stealth Rock against other common entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Glimmora without the use of Flying Tera and pairs incredibly well with Encore.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Tinkaton to get a Thunder Wave off even against powerful attacks from the likes of Terastallized Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Dragapult.

sets.name: Offensive Support
sets.description:
• Despite Tinkaton's low offensive stats, it can still perform as an offensive Pokemon thanks to Gigaton Hammer's enormous 160 Base Power and Swords Dance.

  • Encore: Encore is a fantastic support move, potentially locking foes into resisted moves after a switch-in or denying slower, bulkier foes their recovery moves for a few turns.
